title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 June 2009 - XWiki
content:
arkub left at 00:03 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 00:18  
anamarias left at 00:35 ()  
bbc581 left at 00:46 ("Cya L8r")  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:03): cristinaS: Still awake?  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:04): hi!  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:04): yes , as usually :)  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:04): So you're a night person also?  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:05): Or just becoming one?  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:05): :) maybe becoming one  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:05): I used to go to sleep at 2 a.m   
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:05): in the last period at 3 :)  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:07): As I often say to my mom, if you enjoy what your doing, is it still called work?  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:08): (Hoping that you enjoy what you're doing)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:08): :) yes, i'm really enjoying  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:10): yesterday I've worked with 4 programming languages .. so I don't have time to get bored  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:10): Lucky you, I have to write a research paper...  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:11): oh .. I have also to write one for the graduation project .. :-|   
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:12): but i'm a lazy person , i didn't begin yet  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:12): :))  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:13): It's a bit late...  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:14): i know .. but our graduation project has two parts.. an application .. and the documentation part about the application and research concepts  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:15): and I hope the teachers will enjoy the application (i'll make them a demo) ..   
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:15): And the written part is due later?  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:15): on 13 july I  have to be ready with all of them  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:18): anyway with the new structure .. we had 3 courses this semester and a session of exams , a lot of homeworks, everybody is a little bit late with the diploma project  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:19): I hope for the next generations, they will come back to the old structure .. with one free semester to work at the graduation project  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:21): Hey, 3 courses is still good, at infoiasi the last semester has 6 hard courses instead of the usual 5  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:21): But I agree that there should be a free semester  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:21): Bologna sux  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:22): yes ..  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:22): You can't make something good in these conditions  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:24): I've realized that I had to do 8 projects for the school this semester .. (6 of them were some drivers) .. so they took me a lot of precious time  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:25): At least I hope they were Linux drivers...  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:25): 3 of them .. 3 for windows :-|  
jvelociter left at 01:25 ()  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:26): Hm, you could write a blog entry about this, which way is better and easier  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:26): And which platform offers the most help  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:27): yes it would be interesting .. although in many cases the linux is easier , sometimes in windows it is more clear  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:29): anyway .. we learned a lot from school, but they have to change something .. in the first two years we wasted time with electronics and somethg else , and in the last one when many students work  there are the most interesting courses  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:30): i hope at infoiasi is not the same  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:30): No, we reduced most of the useless stuff  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:30): that's very good  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:31): But there are still a few courses less needed for programmers  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:32): We're trying to create both researchers and programmers with one faculty  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:32): And of course, teachers think that programming is a dirty, low job  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:32): At least the ones in charge  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:33): The younger ones know better, but their voice doesn't matter much  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:33): And it's not profitable to have two branches...  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:33): Almost nobody would choose the research one  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:34): Most students come dreaming that they will learn how to draw stuff in Flash, a bit of PHP, and that's all a programmer should ever need to know...  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:34): oh ..  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:34): how many specialities are there?  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:35): 1  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:35): :D  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:35): For the first 3 years  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:35): at us since the third year we can choose a speciality  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:35): We have 5 masters (I think, I've been gone for 2 years)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:36): and the students really go to the masters? or decide to make one just for the paper?  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:36): Something between  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:37): Some just come to the exams  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:37): Most come to classes, since they are in the evening  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:37): And a few are really interested  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:38): yes.. it is hard to decide if the job is more important or the faculty  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:39): You know, I've been a student at UPB myself, for a year (AC)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:40): yes?  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:40): and why didn't you continue?  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:40): But after so much math, mechatronics, physics, electronics and more math, I dropped out  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:41): I understand .. i had the same problem .. after the first year i really wanted a job as programmer because i was feeling like wasting my time  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:41): with the university  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:42): Eveyrbody sait that after the third year things get interesting, but why the fox should I waste so many years studying stuff I don't need?  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:42): and in the third year a young theacher conviced me that is better to study in this period ..  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:42): I knew I'd never build processors or robots, what do I care about electronics and mechatronics?  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:43): I know .. they should change this..  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:43): Yes, I also advise students to not take a job  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:45): i hope at infoiasi they don't have a reason to take one  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:47): They have, they need money  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:48): yes, this is a problem .. but most of my collegues took a job because they were bored at school  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:48): and after that it was too late to give up at it  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:49): they get used with money and the others  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:49): Hey, being bored is a great reason to start contributing to Free Software  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:51): yes :) .. we intend (me and anamarias ) to make a presenation at our university about gsoc  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:51): and open source software  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:51): and maybe more little students will like the idea  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:52): Big students are welcome too, we don't discriminate on height :D  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:52): ( we want to do this in october after the school begins)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:55): free software should become more popular .. it is a great opportunity for a student to learn a lot  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:56): Yes  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:56): And, what's more interesting for you, Open Hardware is also rising  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:56): (For those that like hardware more than software)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:57): open hardware?  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:57): i didn't heard about them  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:57): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open\_hardware  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:57): (anyway I wouldn't choose open hardware  :)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:58): nice ..   
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 01:58): And there's CoreBoot between the two worlds  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:58): it should become more popular  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 01:59): the CoreBoot sounds also interesesting   
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:00): at our university after the third year when the operating system course is very well done .. everybody dreams to work eith the kernel :)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:00): and in the fourth year when you work with the kernel .. you got a lot of blue screens / kernel panic  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 02:01): :p  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:01): and the enthusiasm goes away..  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:04): I really appreaciate now the high level languages :) ..   
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:07): anyway we wanted to ask you, how did you learn so much? (you answer anytime at everyone at all the questions :P  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 02:08): :p  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:08): don't you want to spread the secret? :)  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 02:10): 1. I have a specialized memory, I only remember stuff that's interesting, and I usually learn it fast and I remember it easily. The downside is that I usually forget life stuff, like what the hell am I looking for in the fridge (the answer usually is socks)  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 02:10): 2. Experience  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:10): :)  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:21): i'm going to sleep..  
cristinaS - (12/06/2009 02:21): bye!  
cristinaS left at 02:21 ("Bersirc 2.2, for external use only. [ http://www.bersirc.org/ - Open Source IRC ]")

arunreddy\_ - (12/06/2009 12:46): sdumitriu : Hi  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 12:47): Hi arunreddy\_  
arunreddy\_ - (12/06/2009 12:47): How to access the module we are writing in XE.  
arunreddy\_ - (12/06/2009 12:48): Writing and Accessing Components way. ?    
arunreddy\_ - (12/06/2009 12:48): Using velocity or groovy.  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 12:49): Make a velocity bridge  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 12:50): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-localization/src/main/java/org/xwiki/localization/internal/LocalizationManagerVelocityContextInitializer.java  
arunreddy\_ - (12/06/2009 13:03): Am is supposed to write a new one and extend this class.?  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 13:05): Write a new one, but don't extend that class  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 13:05): That's just an example  
sdumitriu - (12/06/2009 13:05): Do something similar  
j-saturne joined #xwiki at 13:05  
arunreddy\_ - (12/06/2009 13:07): Ok :)
